Description: Square panel of tapestry depicting in a central medallion a red and green tree (tree of life?). On either side of the trunk are two red circles. This sits within a square with a purple background, surrounded by a freize of purple and red stylized vegetal interlacing on a purple background, and itself surrounded by a freize of inverted scallops with purple dots at each centre. Some details are in flying threads. There is a slit tapestry between the plain weave and the tapestry. Plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/28), weft- undyed linen (S/12). Tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/grouped by 3-4/9), weft-undyed linen (S/44), red, purple and green wool (S/red is 72). Flying threads in undyed linen (S); slit tapestry closed with oversewing in undyed linen (S). One selvedge is preserved on the right and the other edges are cut
